3162.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3162
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 1
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3162
3162.text:
It was narrated that Umm Kurz said:
“I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) say: ‘On behalf of a boy, two sheep of equal age and on behalf of a girl one sheep.’”

It was narrated that Umm Kurz said:
“I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) say: ‘On behalf of a boy, two sheep of equal age and on behalf of a girl one sheep.’”

3163.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3163
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 2
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3163
3163.text:
It was narrated that ‘Aishah said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded us to sacrifice two sheep for a boy’s ‘Aqiqah and one sheep for a girl.”

It was narrated that ‘Aishah said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded us to sacrifice two sheep for a boy’s ‘Aqiqah and one sheep for a girl.”

3164.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3164
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 3
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3164
3164.text:
It was narrated from Salman bin ‘Amir that he heard the Prophet (ﷺ) say:
“For a boy there should be an ‘Aqiqah, so shed blood for him and remove the harm from him.”

It was narrated from Salman bin ‘Amir that he heard the Prophet (ﷺ) say:
“For a boy there should be an ‘Aqiqah, so shed blood for him and remove the harm from him.”

3165.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3165
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 4
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3165
3165.text:
It was narrated from Samurah that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
“Every boy is mortgaged by his ‘Aqiqah, so slaughter for him on the seventh day, and shave his head, and name him.”

It was narrated from Samurah that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
“Every boy is mortgaged by his ‘Aqiqah, so slaughter for him on the seventh day, and shave his head, and name him.”

3166.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3166
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 5
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3166
3166.text:
Yazid bin ‘Abdul-Muzani narrated that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
“Offer an ‘Aqiqah for the boy, but do not smear his head with blood.”

Yazid bin ‘Abdul-Muzani narrated that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
“Offer an ‘Aqiqah for the boy, but do not smear his head with blood.”

3167.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3167
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 6
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3167
3167.text:
It was narrated that Nubaishah said:
“A man called the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, we used to sacrifice the ‘Atirah during the Ignorance days in Rajab,; what do you command us to do?’ He said: “Sacrifice to Allah whatever month it is, do good for the sake of Allah and feed (the poor).’ They said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, we used to sacrifice the Far’ah during the Ignorance days; what do you command us to do?’ He said: ‘For every Sa’imah* (flock of grazing animals), feed the firstborn as you feed the rest of your flock until it reaches an age where it could be used to carry loads, then sacrifice it, and give its meat in charity’ – I** think he said – ‘to the wayfarer, for that is good.’”

It was narrated that Nubaishah said:
“A man called the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, we used to sacrifice the ‘Atirah during the Ignorance days in Rajab,; what do you command us to do?’ He said: “Sacrifice to Allah whatever month it is, do good for the sake of Allah and feed (the poor).’ They said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, we used to sacrifice the Far’ah during the Ignorance days; what do you command us to do?’ He said: ‘For every Sa’imah* (flock of grazing animals), feed the firstborn as you feed the rest of your flock until it reaches an age where it could be used to carry loads, then sacrifice it, and give its meat in charity’ – I** think he said – ‘to the wayfarer, for that is good.’”

3168.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3168
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 7
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3168
3168.text:
It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
“There is no Far’ah and no ‘Atirah.”

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
“There is no Far’ah and no ‘Atirah.”

3169.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3169
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 8
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3169
3169.text:
It was narrated from Muhammad bin Abu (‘Umar) ‘Adani that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
“There is no Far’ah and no ‘Atirah.”

It was narrated from Muhammad bin Abu (‘Umar) ‘Adani that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
“There is no Far’ah and no ‘Atirah.”

3170.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3170
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 9
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3170
3170.text:
It was narrated from Shaddad bin Aws that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
“Allah has prescribed Al-Ihsan (proficiency) in all things. So if you kill, then kill well, and if you slaughter, then slaughter well. Let one of you sharpen his blade and spare suffering to the animal he slaughters.”

It was narrated from Shaddad bin Aws that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
“Allah has prescribed Al-Ihsan (proficiency) in all things. So if you kill, then kill well, and if you slaughter, then slaughter well. Let one of you sharpen his blade and spare suffering to the animal he slaughters.”

3171.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3171
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 10
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3171
3171.text:
It was narrated that Abu Sa’eed Al-Khudri said:
“The Prophet (ﷺ) passed by a man who was dragging a sheep by its ear. He said: ‘Leave its ear alone and hold it by the sides of its neck.’”

It was narrated that Abu Sa’eed Al-Khudri said:
“The Prophet (ﷺ) passed by a man who was dragging a sheep by its ear. He said: ‘Leave its ear alone and hold it by the sides of its neck.’”

3172.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3172
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 11
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3172
3172.text:
It was narrated that ‘Abdullah bin ‘Umar said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded that the blade should be sharpened, and hidden from the animals, and he said: ‘When one of you slaughters, let him do it quickly.’”
Another chain reports the same.

It was narrated that ‘Abdullah bin ‘Umar said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded that the blade should be sharpened, and hidden from the animals, and he said: ‘When one of you slaughters, let him do it quickly.’”
Another chain reports the same.

3173.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3173
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 12
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3173
3173.text:
It was narrated from Ibn ‘Abbas:
“And certainly, the Shayatin (devils) do inspire their friends (from mankind).” [6:121] He said: “They used to say: ‘Whatever the Name of Allah has been mentioned over, do not eat it, and whatever the Name of Allah has not been mentioned over, eat it.’ Then Allah said: “Eat not of that over which Allah’s Name has not been pronounced.’” [6:121]

It was narrated from Ibn ‘Abbas:
“And certainly, the Shayatin (devils) do inspire their friends (from mankind).” [6:121] He said: “They used to say: ‘Whatever the Name of Allah has been mentioned over, do not eat it, and whatever the Name of Allah has not been mentioned over, eat it.’ Then Allah said: “Eat not of that over which Allah’s Name has not been pronounced.’” [6:121]

3174.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3174
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 13
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3174
3174.text:
It was narrated from ‘Aishah, the Mother of the Believers, that some people said:
“O Messenger of Allah, some people bring us meat, and we do not know whether the Name of Allah has been mentioned over it or not.” He said: “Say: Bismillah and eat.’ They were new in Islam.

It was narrated from ‘Aishah, the Mother of the Believers, that some people said:
“O Messenger of Allah, some people bring us meat, and we do not know whether the Name of Allah has been mentioned over it or not.” He said: “Say: Bismillah and eat.’ They were new in Islam.

3175.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3175
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 14
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3175
3175.text:
It was narrated that Muhammad bin Saifi said:
“I slaughtered two rabbits with a sharp-edges stone and brought them to the Prophet (ﷺ), and he told me to eat them.”

It was narrated that Muhammad bin Saifi said:
“I slaughtered two rabbits with a sharp-edges stone and brought them to the Prophet (ﷺ), and he told me to eat them.”

3176.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3176
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 15
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3176
3176.text:
It was narrated from Zaid bin Thabit that a wolf bit a sheep, and they slaughtered it with a sharp-edged stone, and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) allowed them to eat it.

It was narrated from Zaid bin Thabit that a wolf bit a sheep, and they slaughtered it with a sharp-edged stone, and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) allowed them to eat it.

3177.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3177
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 16
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3177
3177.text:
It was narrated that ‘Adi bin Hatim said:
“I said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, we hunt game but we cannot find anything but the sharp edge of a stone or stick (with which to slaughter it).’ He said: ‘Cause the blood to flow with whatever you want, and mention the Name of Allah over it.’”

It was narrated that ‘Adi bin Hatim said:
“I said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, we hunt game but we cannot find anything but the sharp edge of a stone or stick (with which to slaughter it).’ He said: ‘Cause the blood to flow with whatever you want, and mention the Name of Allah over it.’”

3178.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3178
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 17
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3178
3178.text:
It was narrated that Rafi’ bin Khadij said:
“We were with the Prophet (ﷺ) on a journey, and I said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, we are (sometimes) on military campaigns, and we have no knife with us.’ He said: ‘(Use) whatever causes the blood to flow, mention the Name of Allah and eat, but (do not use) teeth or nails, for the tooth is a bone and the nail is the knife of the Ethiopians.”

It was narrated that Rafi’ bin Khadij said:
“We were with the Prophet (ﷺ) on a journey, and I said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, we are (sometimes) on military campaigns, and we have no knife with us.’ He said: ‘(Use) whatever causes the blood to flow, mention the Name of Allah and eat, but (do not use) teeth or nails, for the tooth is a bone and the nail is the knife of the Ethiopians.”

3179.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3179
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 18
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3179
3179.text:
It was narrated from Abu Sa’eed Al-Khudri that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) passed by a boy who was skinning a sheep. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to him:
“Step aside and I will show you how.” The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) put his hand between the skin and the flesh, and thrust his arm in until it disappeared up to the armpit, and said: “O boy, this is how you skin it.” Then he went and led the people in prayer and did not perform Wudu’.

It was narrated from Abu Sa’eed Al-Khudri that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) passed by a boy who was skinning a sheep. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to him:
“Step aside and I will show you how.” The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) put his hand between the skin and the flesh, and thrust his arm in until it disappeared up to the armpit, and said: “O boy, this is how you skin it.” Then he went and led the people in prayer and did not perform Wudu’.

3180.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3180
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 19
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3180
3180.text:
It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) came to a man from among the Ansar who had picked up a knife to slaughter an animal for the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to him:
“Avoid those that are lactating.” (i.e. those from which milk is received).

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) came to a man from among the Ansar who had picked up a knife to slaughter an animal for the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to him:
“Avoid those that are lactating.” (i.e. those from which milk is received).

3181.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3181
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 20
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3181
3181.text:
Abu Hurairah narrated that Abu Bakr bin Abu Quhafah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to him and to ‘Umar:
“Let us go out to Waqifi.” He said: “So we went out in the moonlight until we came to the garden and he (the owner of the garden) said: ‘Welcome.’ Then he took up the knife and went among the sheep (to choose one for slaughter), and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: ‘Avoid those that are lactating.’”

Abu Hurairah narrated that Abu Bakr bin Abu Quhafah narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to him and to ‘Umar:
“Let us go out to Waqifi.” He said: “So we went out in the moonlight until we came to the garden and he (the owner of the garden) said: ‘Welcome.’ Then he took up the knife and went among the sheep (to choose one for slaughter), and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: ‘Avoid those that are lactating.’”

3182.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3182
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 21
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3182
3182.text:
It was narrated from a son of Ka’b bin Malik, from his father, that a woman slaughtered a sheep with a stone, and that was mentioned to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), but he did not see anything wrong with that.

It was narrated from a son of Ka’b bin Malik, from his father, that a woman slaughtered a sheep with a stone, and that was mentioned to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), but he did not see anything wrong with that.

3183.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3183
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 22
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3183
3183.text:
It was narrated that Rafi’ bin Khadij said:
“We were with the Prophet (ﷺ) on a journey, and a camel ran away. A man shot an arrow at it and the Prophet (ﷺ) said: ‘It has the inclination to run away like a wild animal. If this happens to any of you, do likewise.’”

It was narrated that Rafi’ bin Khadij said:
“We were with the Prophet (ﷺ) on a journey, and a camel ran away. A man shot an arrow at it and the Prophet (ﷺ) said: ‘It has the inclination to run away like a wild animal. If this happens to any of you, do likewise.’”

3184.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3184
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 23
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3184
3184.text:
It was narrated from Abu ‘Ushara’ that his father said:
“I said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, should slaughtering only be done in the throat or upper chest?’ He said: ‘If you stab it in the thigh that will suffice you.’”

It was narrated from Abu ‘Ushara’ that his father said:
“I said: ‘O Messenger of Allah, should slaughtering only be done in the throat or upper chest?’ He said: ‘If you stab it in the thigh that will suffice you.’”

3185.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3185
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 24
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3185
3185.text:
It was narrated that Abu Sa’eed Al-Khudri said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade mutilating animals.”

It was narrated that Abu Sa’eed Al-Khudri said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade mutilating animals.”

3186.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3186
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 25
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3186
3186.text:
It was narrated that Anas bin Malik said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade tying up animals.”

It was narrated that Anas bin Malik said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade tying up animals.”

3187.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3187
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 26
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3187
3187.text:
It was narrated from Ibn ‘Abbas that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
‘Do not take anything with a soul as a target.”

It was narrated from Ibn ‘Abbas that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:
‘Do not take anything with a soul as a target.”

3188.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3188
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 27
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3188
3188.text:
Jabir bin ‘Abdullah said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade killing any animal when it is tied up (for use as a target).”

Jabir bin ‘Abdullah said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade killing any animal when it is tied up (for use as a target).”

3189.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3189
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 28
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3189
3189.text:
It was narrated that Ibn ‘Umar said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade the meat and milk of Al-Jallalah.”*

It was narrated that Ibn ‘Umar said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade the meat and milk of Al-Jallalah.”*

3190.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3190
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 29
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3190
3190.text:
It was narrated that Asm’a bint Abu Bakr said:
“We slaughtered a horse and ate its meat during the time of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).”

It was narrated that Asm’a bint Abu Bakr said:
“We slaughtered a horse and ate its meat during the time of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).”

3191.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3191
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 30
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3191
3191.text:
It was narrated from Abu Zubair that he heard Jabir bin ‘Abdullah say:
“At the time of Khaibar we ate horses and wild donkeys.”

It was narrated from Abu Zubair that he heard Jabir bin ‘Abdullah say:
“At the time of Khaibar we ate horses and wild donkeys.”

3192.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3192
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 31
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3192
3192.text:
It was narrated that Abu Ishaq Shaibani said:
“I asked ‘Abdullah bin Abu Awfa about the flesh of domesticated donkeys and he said: ‘We were starving on the Day of Khaibar, when we were with the Prophet (ﷺ). The people had gotten some donkeys as spoils of war on the way out from Al-Madinah, so we slaughtered them and our cooking pots were boiling when the caller of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) cried out, telling us to overturn out pots and not to eat anything of the flesh of donkeys. So we overturned them.’ I said to ‘Abdullah bin Abu Awfa: ‘Was it made unlawful?’ He said: ‘We think that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade it altogether because it eats excrement.’”

It was narrated that Abu Ishaq Shaibani said:
“I asked ‘Abdullah bin Abu Awfa about the flesh of domesticated donkeys and he said: ‘We were starving on the Day of Khaibar, when we were with the Prophet (ﷺ). The people had gotten some donkeys as spoils of war on the way out from Al-Madinah, so we slaughtered them and our cooking pots were boiling when the caller of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) cried out, telling us to overturn out pots and not to eat anything of the flesh of donkeys. So we overturned them.’ I said to ‘Abdullah bin Abu Awfa: ‘Was it made unlawful?’ He said: ‘We think that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade it altogether because it eats excrement.’”

3193.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3193
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 32
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3193
3193.text:
It was narrated from Miqdam bin Ma’dikarib Al-Kindi that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade several things, until he mentioned (the meat of) domesticated donkeys.

It was narrated from Miqdam bin Ma’dikarib Al-Kindi that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade several things, until he mentioned (the meat of) domesticated donkeys.

3194.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3194
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 33
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3194
3194.text:
It was narrated that Bara’ bin ‘Azib said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded us to throw away the meat of domesticated donkeys, raw or cooked, then he did not say anything to us about it after that.”

It was narrated that Bara’ bin ‘Azib said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded us to throw away the meat of domesticated donkeys, raw or cooked, then he did not say anything to us about it after that.”

3195.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3195
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 34
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3195
3195.text:
It was narrated that Salamah bin Akwa’ said:
“We went out with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on the campaign of Khaibar, and in the evening the people lit their fires. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: ‘What are you cooking?’ They said: ‘The meat of domesticated donkeys.’ He said: ‘Throw out what is in them (the pots) and break them.’ A man said: ‘Or can we throw out what is in them and wash them?’ The Prophet (ﷺ) said: ‘Or (do) that.’”

It was narrated that Salamah bin Akwa’ said:
“We went out with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) on the campaign of Khaibar, and in the evening the people lit their fires. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: ‘What are you cooking?’ They said: ‘The meat of domesticated donkeys.’ He said: ‘Throw out what is in them (the pots) and break them.’ A man said: ‘Or can we throw out what is in them and wash them?’ The Prophet (ﷺ) said: ‘Or (do) that.’”

3196.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3196
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 35
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3196
3196.text:
It was narrated from Anas bin Malik that the caller of the Prophet (ﷺ) cried out:
“Allah and His Messenger forbid you to eat the flesh of domesticated donkeys, for it is filthy.”

It was narrated from Anas bin Malik that the caller of the Prophet (ﷺ) cried out:
“Allah and His Messenger forbid you to eat the flesh of domesticated donkeys, for it is filthy.”

3197.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3197
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 36
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3197
3197.text:
It was narrated that ‘Ata’ narrated that Jabir bin ‘Abdullah said:
“We used to eat the meat of horses.” I said: “And mules?” He said: “No.”

It was narrated that ‘Ata’ narrated that Jabir bin ‘Abdullah said:
“We used to eat the meat of horses.” I said: “And mules?” He said: “No.”

3198.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3198
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 37
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3198
3198.text:
It was narrated that Khalid bin Walid said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade the flesh of horses, mules and donkeys.”

It was narrated that Khalid bin Walid said:
“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade the flesh of horses, mules and donkeys.”

3199.reference:
Reference  : Sunan Ibn Majah 3199
In-book reference  : Book 27, Hadith 38
English translation  : Vol. 4, Book 27, Hadith 3199
3199.text:
It was narrated that Abu Sa’eed said:
“We asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) about the fetus. He said: ‘Eat it if you wish, for it is considered legally slaughtered with the slaughtering of its mother.’”

It was narrated that Abu Sa’eed said:
“We asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) about the fetus. He said: ‘Eat it if you wish, for it is considered legally slaughtered with the slaughtering of its mother.’”
